main event: A resident of Canton, Ohio observed a red light moving in an erratic, slow motion towards the east on May 20, 1958.
interesting points: The object appeared as a small, red light with no visible body or other features.
The motion of the object was described as slow and erratic, unlike a typical aircraft or balloon.
The report mentions that a weather balloon was released from Warren, Ohio around the time of the sighting, but the observer believed the object was not the balloon.
The observer called the local air force center to report the sighting, and they said they would send an air radar alert about it.
The observer stated that this was the first time they had seen an object like this.
